channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: History shows investors should keep a tight leash on risk once the Fed cuts rates, strategist says
item.description: Trimming stock positions depends on the reason for the Fed reducing borrowing costs

item.title: Ford upgrades Lincoln Navigator to include spa mode, 48-inch display for videos and gaming
item.description: The new features come as the automaker has redesigned the exterior and interior of the Lincoln Navigator for the 2025 model year.

item.title: Bayer shares soar 12% after key U.S. legal win against Roundup cancer claims
item.description: Bayer shares rose as the company said it scored a legal victory in its suit over claims that exposure to its popular Roundup weed killer led to cancer.

item.title: Revolut share sale values U.K. fintech at $45 billion ahead of planned IPO
item.description: Revolut on Friday said a secondary share sale was set at valuation of $45 billion, making it Europe‚Äôs most valuable privately-owned technology company.

item.title: Columbia University president resigns months after Israel-Hamas war protests roiled campus
item.description: Columbia University President Minouche Shafik said she resigned on Wednesday, nearly four months after overseeing the university's handling of campus protests over Israel's war in Gaza.

item.title: Europe stocks higher to round off winning week; Sterling gains after slew of UK data
item.description: European stocks were higher as the Stoxx 600 index continues to climb.

item.title: New CEOs and positive earnings have these stocks moving
item.description: Good day, 360! Here are our top investing ideas today. And TODAY, Jason is opening up the Roadmap Room for live trading with him today at 12EST. item.title: Harris to endorse protections for renters and removal of key tax benefits for Wall St. investors buying homes
item.description: Harris has begun to provide details about her policy positions after abruptly becoming the Democratic nominee.

item.title: Alibaba, JD.com results underscore the slowdown in Chinese consumer demand
item.description: Second-quarter results from Chinese e-commerce giants Alibaba and JD.com indicate a weak market, with domestic and foreign players struggling to attract customers.

item.title: ‚ÄòI want so badly to help her‚Äô: My girlfriend made a $60,000 ‚Äòerror of judgment‚Äô at work. Should I take out a HELOC or dip into my 401(k) to bail her out?
item.description: ‚ÄúIf she doesn‚Äôt repay the money, she believes she will lose her $100,000 job and possibly be sued for the $60,000.‚Äù

item.title: Cisco shares have best day since 2020 on earnings beat, plans to cut 7% of workforce
item.description: Cisco shares jumped on Thursday and were on pace for their best day since November 2020, after the networking company announced layoffs and an earnings beat.

item.title: After medic's rape and murder, Indian doctors stage 24-hour nationwide strike
item.description: The Indian Medical Association has called for a suspension of non-emergency medical services from Saturday 6 am local time.

item.title: ‚ÄòNot tipping 20% makes you look like a fascist‚Äô: Why has tipping, once branded as un-American and anti-democratic, become such a hot political issue?
item.description: Tipped workers may comprise only 2.5% of the workforce, but all of us are tippers.

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg receives letter from lawmakers concerned about illicit drug ads on Facebook and Instagram
item.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers sent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg a letter expressing concern about illicit drug advertisements running on the company's apps.

item.title: Japan's Nikkei soars over 3% to clock best week in 4 years amid a broad rally in Asia markets
item.description: Traders in Asia digested non-oil exports data from Singapore, which massively beat Reuters' poll expectations
